intro: Terminalia scutifera, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and dense, spherical clusters of white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that contain hard, angular seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savannas and woodland areas. Terminalia scutifera is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in local medicine.
